meanings.definition: A branch office or facility located away from the main headquarters.
meanings.sent1: The company opened an outstation in a bustling city to expand its reach.
meanings.sent2: Employees from the outstation often traveled to the main office for meetings.

meanings.definition: To assign an employee to work at a remote location.
meanings.sent1: The manager decided to outstation a team member to oversee the project in the rural area.
meanings.sent2: They outstationed experienced staff to handle the operations at the new branch.
meanings.sent3: The company outstationed the IT specialist to troubleshoot issues at the distant office.
meanings.sent4: She outstationed the top salesperson to boost performance at the faraway store.
meanings.sent5: Outstationing employees can sometimes lead to improved efficiency in certain projects.
